title.raw: 《孝景本紀》 Annals of the Xiaojing Emperor

sentences.zh: 孝景皇帝者，孝文之中子也。

translations.literal: Emperor Xiaojing was Emperor Xiaowen's middle son.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Xiaojing was the middle son of Emperor Xiaowen.

translations.literal: Mother Empress Dowager Dou.
translations.idiomatic: His mother was Empress Dowager Dou.

sentences.zh: 孝文在代時，前后有三男，及竇太后得幸，前后死，及三子更死，故孝景得立。

translations.literal: When Xiaowen was in Dai, he had three sons before and after, and when Empress Dowager Dou found favor, the previous ones died, and the three sons died again, therefore Xiaojing was able to be established.
translations.idiomatic: While Emperor Xiaowen was still in Dai as prince, he had three sons from earlier and later periods. After Empress Dowager Dou rose to power, the previous sons died, and then those three sons died as well. This is why Emperor Xiaojing was able to ascend the throne.

translations.literal: Emperor Jing was the middle son of Emperor Wen. His mother was Empress Dou. When Emperor Wen was in Dai, the empress previously had three sons, and after Empress Dou was favored, the previous empress died, and the three sons also died, therefore Emperor Jing was able to be established.
First year fourth month yimao, granted amnesty to all under Heaven.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month of his first year, on the yimao day, he granted a general amnesty throughout the empire.

translations.literal: Yisi, bestowed nobility one level on the people.
translations.idiomatic: On the yisi day, he granted the common people one level of nobility rank.

sentences.zh: 五月，除田半租，為孝文立太宗廟。

translations.literal: In the fifth month, eliminated the half land tax, established the Supreme Ancestral Temple for Xiaowen.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month, he eliminated the half-tax on agricultural land and established the Supreme Ancestral Temple for Emperor Xiaowen.

translations.literal: Ordered assembled ministers without court congratulations.
translations.idiomatic: He ordered the assembled ministers to dispense with the court congratulations ceremony.

translations.literal: Xiongnu entered Dai, made agreement for peaceful marriage alliance.
translations.idiomatic: The Xiongnu invaded Dai, so he made a treaty of peaceful marriage alliance with them.

translations.literal: In the first year, fourth month, on the day Bingmao, pardon the world. On the day Bisi, grant the people nobility one level. Fifth month, abolish half the land rent, establish the Taizong Temple for Emperor Wen. Order the assembled ministers not to offer court congratulations. The Xiongnu entered Dai, made peace treaty with them.

sentences.zh: 二年春，封故相國蕭何孫系為武陵侯。

translations.literal: In the second year spring, enfeoffed the former Chancellor Xiao He's grandson Xi as the Marquis of Wuling.
translations.idiomatic: In the spring of his second year, he enfeoffed Xi, grandson of the former Chancellor Xiao He, as Marquis of Wuling.

translations.literal: Males at twenty then received registration.
translations.idiomatic: Men at twenty received their registration for military service.

translations.literal: Fourth month renwu, Empress Dowager Xiaowen collapsed.
translations.idiomatic: On the renwu day of the fourth month, Empress Dowager Xiaowen passed away.

translations.literal: Guangchuan, Changsha kings both went to their states.
translations.idiomatic: The Kings of Guangchuan and Changsha both returned to their fiefs.

translations.literal: Chancellor Shen Tu Jia died.
translations.idiomatic: Chancellor Shen Tu Jia passed away.

sentences.zh: 八月，以御史大夫開封陶青為丞相。

translations.literal: In the eighth month, used the Grandee Secretary of Kaifeng, Tao Qing, as Chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month, he appointed Tao Qing of Kaifeng, the Grandee Secretary, as Chancellor.

translations.literal: Comet appeared northeast.
translations.idiomatic: A comet appeared in the northeast.

sentences.zh: 秋，衡山雨雹，大者五寸，深者二尺。

translations.literal: In autumn, Mount Heng rained hail, the large ones five inches, the deep ones two feet.
translations.idiomatic: In autumn, Mount Heng was struck by hail, with the largest stones five inches across and accumulations two feet deep.

translations.literal: Mars moved retrograde, guarded Beichen.
translations.idiomatic: Mars moved in retrograde motion and remained close to the North Star.

translations.literal: Moon appeared between Beichen.
translations.idiomatic: The moon appeared close to the North Star.

translations.literal: Jupiter moved retrograde in Heavenly Court center.
translations.idiomatic: Jupiter moved in retrograde motion within the central region of the Heavenly Court constellation.

sentences.zh: 置南陵及內史、祋祤為縣。

translations.literal: Established Nanling and also Neishi and Qirong as counties.
translations.idiomatic: He established Nanling and also made Neishi and Qirong into counties.

translations.literal: Second year spring, enfeoff former Chancellor Xiao He's grandson Xi as Marquis of Wuling. Men at twenty receive registration. Fourth month on the day Renwu, Empress Wen died. Guangchuan and Changsha kings all went to their fiefs. Chancellor Shen Tu Jia died. Eighth month, appointed Imperial Secretary Kaifeng Tao Qing as chancellor. Comet appeared in the northeast. Autumn, in Hengshan hail fell, large ones five inches, deep ones two feet. Mars moved retrograde, guarded Beichen. Moon appeared between Beichen. Jupiter moved retrograde in the Heavenly Court. Established Nanling and within the Interior commandery, Sheyu as counties.
Third year first month yisi, granted amnesty to all under Heaven.
translations.idiomatic: In the first month of his third year, on the yisi day, he granted a general amnesty throughout the empire.

translations.literal: Long star appeared west.
translations.idiomatic: A comet appeared in the west.

sentences.zh: 天火燔雒陽東宮大殿城室。

translations.literal: Heavenly fire burned Luoyang Eastern Palace great hall city chambers.
translations.idiomatic: Heavenly fire burned the great hall and city chambers of the Eastern Palace in Luoyang.

sentences.zh: 吳王濞、楚王戊、趙王遂、膠西王卬、濟南王辟光、菑川王賢、膠東王雄渠反，發兵西鄉。

translations.literal: King Bi of Wu, King Wu of Chu, King Sui of Zhao, King Ang of Jiaoxi, King Pi Guang of Jinan, King Xian of Zichuan, King Xiong Qu of Jiaodong rebelled, sent the troops west toward.
translations.idiomatic: Kings Bi of Wu, Wu of Chu, Sui of Zhao, Ang of Jiaoxi, Pi Guang of Jinan, Xian of Zichuan, and Xiong Qu of Jiaodong rebelled and sent the troops marching westward.

sentences.zh: 天子為誅晁錯，遣袁盎諭告，不止，遂西圍梁。

translations.literal: The Son of Heaven to execute Chao Cuo, sent Yuan Ang to admonish inform, did not stop, consequently west besieged Liang.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor executed Chao Cuo and sent Yuan Ang to admonish the rebels, but they did not stop, so they marched west and besieged Liang.

sentences.zh: 上乃遣大將軍竇嬰、太尉周亞夫將兵誅之。

translations.literal: The emperor then sent Grand General Dou Ying, Grand Commandant Zhou Yafu to lead troops execute them.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor then sent Grand General Dou Ying and Grand Commandant Zhou Yafu to lead troops and suppress the rebellion.

translations.literal: Sixth month yihai.
translations.idiomatic: Sixth month, yihai day.

sentences.zh: 赦亡軍及楚元王子藝等與謀反者。

translations.literal: Granted amnesty to deserters and Chu Yuan Wang's son Yi and others who participated in rebellion.
translations.idiomatic: He granted amnesty to the deserters and to Prince Yi of Chu and others who had participated in the rebellion.

sentences.zh: 封大將軍竇嬰為魏其侯。

translations.literal: Enfeoffed Grand General Dou Ying as Marquis of Weiqi.
translations.idiomatic: He enfeoffed Grand General Dou Ying as the Marquis of Weiqi.

sentences.zh: 立楚元王子平陸侯禮為楚王。

translations.literal: Installed Chu Yuan Wang's son Ping Lu Hou Li as King of Chu.
translations.idiomatic: He installed Li, son of the former King Yuan of Chu and Marquis of Pinglu, as the King of Chu.

sentences.zh: 立皇子端為膠西王，子勝為中山王。

translations.literal: Installed imperial son Duan as the King of Jiaoxi, son Sheng as the King of Zhongshan.
translations.idiomatic: He installed his son Duan as the King of Jiaoxi and his son Sheng as the King of Zhongshan.

sentences.zh: 徙濟北王志為菑川王，淮陽王餘為魯王，汝南王非為江都王。

translations.literal: Moved the King Zhi of Jibei to be the King of Zichuan, the King Yu of Huaiyang to be the King of Lu, the King Fei of Runan to be the King of Jiangdu.
translations.idiomatic: He transferred King Zhi of Jibei to become the King of Zichuan, King Yu of Huaiyang to become the King of Lu, and King Fei of Runan to become the King of Jiangdu.

translations.literal: King Jianglu of Qi, King Jia of Yan both passed away.
translations.idiomatic: King Jianglu of Qi and King Jia of Yan both passed away.

translations.literal: Third year first month on the day Bingji, pardon the world. Long star appeared in the west. Heavenly fire burned Luoyang's eastern palace great hall and city rooms. Wu King Bi, Chu King Wu, Zhao King Sui, Jiaoxi King Ang, Jinan King Pi Guang, Zichuan King Xian, Jiaodong King Xiong Qu rebelled, raised troops heading west. The emperor executed Chao Cuo, sent Yuan Ang to explain and warn, they did not stop, then surrounded Liang in the west. The emperor then sent Grand General Dou Ying, Grand Commandant Zhou Yaofu to lead troops to execute them. Sixth month on the day Binghai. Pardoned the fleeing army and Chu Yuan King's son Yi and others who conspired in rebellion. Enfeoffed Grand General Dou Ying as Marquis of Weiqi. Established Chu Yuan King's son Pinglu Marquis Li as Chu King. Established imperial son Duan as Jiaoxi King, son Sheng as Zhongshan King. Moved Jibei King Zhi to be Zichuan King, Huaiyang King Yu to be Lu King, Runan King Fei to be Jiangdu King. Qi King Jiang Lu, Yan King Jia both died.
Fourth year summer, established crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: In the summer of his fourth year, he established the crown prince.

translations.literal: Installed imperial son Che as King of Jiaodong.
translations.idiomatic: He installed his son Che as King of Jiaodong.

translations.literal: Sixth month jiaxu, granted amnesty to all under Heaven.
translations.idiomatic: On the jiaxu day of the sixth month, he granted a general amnesty throughout the empire.

sentences.zh: 後九月，更以（弋）［易］陽為陽陵。

translations.literal: Later ninth month, changed the Yi Yang to Yangling.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month thereafter, he changed the name of Yiyang to Yangling.

translations.literal: Again established ferry passes, used tallies for entering exiting.
translations.idiomatic: He reestablished the ferry checkpoints and required travel tallies for entry and exit.

translations.literal: Winter, made Zhao state into Handan commandery.
translations.idiomatic: In winter, he converted the state of Zhao into Handan commandery.

translations.literal: Fourth year summer, established the crown prince. Established imperial son Che as Jiaodong King. Sixth month on the day Jiaxu, pardon the world. After nine months, changed Yiyang to Yangling. Again established ferry passes, use passes to enter and exit. Winter, made Zhao kingdom into Handan commandery.
Fifth year third month, constructed Yangling, Wei Bridge.
translations.idiomatic: In the third month of his fifth year, he constructed Yangling tomb and the Wei Bridge.

sentences.zh: 五月，募徙陽陵，予錢二十萬。

translations.literal: Fifth month, recruited relocated Yangling, gave money 200,000.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month, he recruited people to relocate to Yangling and gave them 200,000 cash each.

sentences.zh: 江都大暴風從西方來，壞城十二丈。

translations.literal: Jiangdu great violent wind came from the west, damaged the city twelve zhang.
translations.idiomatic: A great gale wind came from the west at Jiangdu and damaged twelve zhang of the city wall.

sentences.zh: 丁卯，封長公主子蟜為隆慮侯。

translations.literal: Dingmao, enfeoffed eldest princess's son Mang as Marquis of Longlu.
translations.idiomatic: On the dingmao day, he enfeoffed Mang, son of the eldest princess, as Marquis of Longlu.

translations.literal: Transferred King of Guangchuan to be King of Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: He transferred the King of Guangchuan to become King of Zhao.

translations.literal: Fifth year third month, built Yangling and Wei Bridge. Fifth month, recruited migrants to Yangling, gave money twenty thousand. Jiangdu great storm wind came from the west, destroyed city walls twelve zhang. On the day Dingmao, enfeoff eldest princess's son Dang as Marquis of Longlu. Moved Guangchuan King to be Zhao King.

sentences.zh: 六年春，封中尉（趙）綰為建陵侯，江都丞相嘉為建平侯，隴西太守渾邪為平曲侯，趙丞相嘉為江陵侯，故將軍布為鄃侯。

translations.literal: Sixth year spring, enfeoffed the Commandant-in-Chief Wan as the Marquis of Jianling, the Jiangdu Chancellor Jia as the Marquis of Jianping, the Longxi Governor Hunye as the Marquis of Pingqu, the Zhao Chancellor Jia as the Marquis of Jiangling, the former General Bu as the Marquis of Zhu.
translations.idiomatic: In the spring of his sixth year, he enfeoffed Wan the Commandant-in-Chief as Marquis of Jianling, Jia the Chancellor of Jiangdu as Marquis of Jianping, Hunye the Governor of Longxi as Marquis of Pingqu, Jia the Chancellor of Zhao as Marquis of Jiangling, and Bu the former general as Marquis of Zhu.

translations.literal: Liang Chu two kings both passed away.
translations.idiomatic: The Kings of Liang and Chu both passed away.

sentences.zh: 後九月，伐馳道樹，殖蘭池。

translations.literal: Later ninth month, cut down imperial highway trees, planted around Orchid Pond.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month thereafter, he had trees cut down along the imperial highways and planted around the Orchid Pond.

translations.literal: Sixth year spring, enfeoff Central Commandant Zhao Wan as Marquis of Jianling, Jiangdu Chancellor Jia as Marquis of Jianping, Longxi Governor Hun Ye as Marquis of Pingqu, Zhao Chancellor Jia as Marquis of Jiangling, former General Bu as Marquis of Ju. Liang and Chu two kings both died. After nine months, cut down the galloping road trees, planted the orchid pond.

sentences.zh: 七年冬，廢栗太子為臨江王。

translations.literal: Seventh year winter, deposed Li crown prince as King of Linjiang.
translations.idiomatic: In the winter of his seventh year, he deposed Crown Prince Li and made him King of Linjiang.

translations.literal: The eleventh month last day, the sun was eclipsed.
translations.idiomatic: On the last day of the eleventh month, there was a solar eclipse.

translations.literal: Spring, exempted convicts and bondservants working on Yangling.
translations.idiomatic: In spring, he exempted convicts and bondservants from working on the Yangling tomb.

translations.literal: Chancellor Qing dismissed.
translations.idiomatic: Chancellor Qing was dismissed from office.

sentences.zh: 二月乙巳，以太尉條侯周亞夫為丞相。

translations.literal: The second month yisi, used the Grand Commandant Tiaohou Zhou Yafu as Chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: On the yisi day of the second month, he appointed Zhou Yafu, Grand Commandant and Marquis of Tiaohou, as Chancellor.

sentences.zh: 四月乙巳，立膠東王太后為皇后。

translations.literal: Fourth month yisi, established Jiaodong King mother as Empress.
translations.idiomatic: On the yisi day of the fourth month, he established the mother of the King of Jiaodong as Empress.

translations.literal: Dingsi, established Jiaodong King as crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: On the dingsi day, he established the King of Jiaodong as crown prince.

translations.literal: Named Che.
translations.idiomatic: His name was Che.

translations.literal: Seventh year winter, deposed Crown Prince Li as Linjiang King. Eleventh month last day, eclipse of the sun. Spring, released those serving as convicts working at Yangling. Chancellor Qing resigned. Second month on the day Biji, appointed Grand Commandant Marquis Tiao Zhou Yaofu as chancellor. Fourth month on the day Biji, established Jiaodong King's mother as empress. On the day Dingsi, established Jiaodong King as crown prince. Named Che.

sentences.zh: 中元年，封故御史大夫周苛孫平為繩侯，故御史大夫周昌（子）［孫］左車為安陽侯，四月乙巳，赦天下，賜爵一級。

translations.literal: The middle first year, enfeoffed the former Grandee Secretary Zhou Ke grandson Ping as the Marquis of Sheng, the former Grandee Secretary Zhou Chang grandson Zuo Che as the Marquis of Anyang, the fourth month yisi, granted amnesty to all under Heaven, bestowed nobility one level.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of the middle period, he enfeoffed Ping, grandson of the former Grandee Secretary Zhou Ke, as Marquis of Sheng, and Zuo Che, grandson of the former Grandee Secretary Zhou Chang, as Marquis of Anyang. On the yisi day of the fourth month, he granted a general amnesty throughout the empire and bestowed one level of nobility on all.

translations.literal: Removed prohibitions and restrictions.
translations.idiomatic: He lifted all prohibitions and restrictions.

translations.literal: Earth moved.
translations.idiomatic: There was an earthquake.

sentences.zh: 衡山、原都雨雹，大者尺八寸。

translations.literal: Mount Heng, Yuandu rained hail, large ones one chi eight cun.
translations.idiomatic: Mount Heng and Yuandu were struck by hail, with the largest stones measuring one chi and eight cun across.

translations.literal: Middle first year, enfeoffed former Imperial Secretary Zhou Ke's grandson Ping as Marquis of Sheng, former Imperial Secretary Zhou Chang's grandson Zuo Che as Marquis of Anyang, fourth month on the day Biji, pardon the world, grant nobility one level. Abolished prohibitions and restrictions. Earthquake. Hengshan, Yuandu hail fell, large ones one chi eight inches.

sentences.zh: 中二年二月，匈奴入燕，遂不和親。

translations.literal: The middle second year second month, the Xiongnu entered Yan, consequently did not peaceful marriage.
translations.idiomatic: In the second month of the second year of the middle period, the Xiongnu invaded Yan, and consequently peaceful marriage relations were abandoned.

translations.literal: Third month, summoned Linjiang King to come.
translations.idiomatic: In the third month, he summoned the King of Linjiang to court.

translations.literal: Immediately died in Commandant-in-Chief office.
translations.idiomatic: He immediately died in the office of the Commandant-in-Chief.

sentences.zh: 夏，立皇子越為廣川王，子寄為膠東王。

translations.literal: Summer, established imperial son Yue as the King of Guangchuan, son Ji as the King of Jiaodong.
translations.idiomatic: In summer, he established his son Yue as the King of Guangchuan and his son Ji as the King of Jiaodong.

translations.literal: Enfeoffed four marquises.
translations.idiomatic: He enfeoffed four marquises.

translations.literal: Ninth month jiaxu, solar eclipse.
translations.idiomatic: On the jiaxu day of the ninth month, there was a solar eclipse.

translations.literal: Middle second year second month, Xiongnu entered Yan, then did not make peace treaty. Third month, summoned Linjiang King to come. He died in the Central Commandant's office. Summer, established imperial son Yue as Guangchuan King, son Ji as Jiaodong King. Enfeoffed four marquises. Ninth month on the day Jiaxu, eclipse of the sun.

sentences.zh: 中三年冬，罷諸侯御史中丞。

translations.literal: Middle third year winter, abolished feudal lords Grandee Secretaries.
translations.idiomatic: In the winter of the third year of the middle period, he abolished the position of Grandee Secretary in the feudal states.

sentences.zh: 春，匈奴王二人率其徒來降，皆封為列侯。

translations.literal: Spring, Xiongnu kings two led their followers came to surrender, all enfeoffed as the marquises.
translations.idiomatic: In spring, two Xiongnu kings led their followers in surrendering, and all were enfeoffed as the marquises.

translations.literal: Middle third year winter, abolished the feudal lords' imperial secretaries. Spring, two Xiongnu kings led their followers to surrender, all enfeoffed as marquises.
Middle fourth year third month, established Deyang Palace.
translations.idiomatic: In the third month of the fourth year of the middle period, he established the Deyang Palace.

translations.literal: Great locusts.
translations.idiomatic: There was a great locust plague.

translations.literal: Autumn, granted amnesty to convicts working on Yangling.
translations.idiomatic: In autumn, he granted amnesty to convicts working on the Yangling tomb.

translations.literal: Middle fourth year third month, established Deyang Palace. Great locusts. Autumn, pardoned convicts working at Yangling.

sentences.zh: 中五年夏，立皇子舜為常山王。

translations.literal: Middle fifth year summer, established imperial son Shun as King of Changshan.
translations.idiomatic: In the summer of the fifth year of the middle period, he established his son Shun as King of Changshan.

translations.literal: Enfeoffed ten marquises.
translations.idiomatic: He enfeoffed ten marquises.

sentences.zh: 六月丁巳，赦天下，賜爵一級。

translations.literal: Sixth month dingsi, granted amnesty to all under Heaven, bestowed nobility one level.
translations.idiomatic: On the dingsi day of the sixth month, he granted a general amnesty throughout the empire and bestowed one level of nobility on all.

translations.literal: All under Heaven great floods.
translations.idiomatic: There were great floods throughout the empire.

translations.literal: Changed name of feudal lords chancellors to chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: He changed the title of the feudal lords' chancellors to simply 'chancellor'.

translations.literal: Autumn, earth moved.
translations.idiomatic: In autumn, there was an earthquake.

translations.literal: Middle fifth year summer, established imperial son Shun as Changshan King. Enfeoffed ten marquises. Sixth month on the day Dingji, pardon the world, grant nobility one level. World great floods. Changed the name of feudal lords' chancellors to 'chancellor'. Autumn, earthquake.

sentences.zh: 中六年二月己卯，行幸雍，郊見五帝。

translations.literal: The middle sixth year second month jimao, proceeded favorably to Yong, suburban sacrifices saw Five Emperors.
translations.idiomatic: On the jimao day of the second month of the sixth year of the middle period, he made an imperial progress to Yong and performed suburban sacrifices to the Five Emperors.

translations.literal: Third month, rained hail.
translations.idiomatic: In the third month, it rained hail.

sentences.zh: 四月，梁孝王、城陽共王、汝南王皆薨。

translations.literal: Fourth month, the Liang Xiaowang, the Chengyang Gongwang, the Runan Wang all passed away.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month, King Xiaowang of Liang, King Gongwang of Chengyang, and the King of Runan all passed away.

sentences.zh: 立梁孝王子明為濟川王，子彭離為濟東王，子定為山陽王，子不識為濟陰王。

translations.literal: Established Liang Xiaowang son Ming as the King of Jichuan, son Pengli as the King of Jidong, son Ding as the King of Shanyang, son Bushi as the King of Jiyin.
translations.idiomatic: He established Ming, son of King Xiaowang of Liang, as the King of Jichuan; Pengli as the King of Jidong; Ding as the King of Shanyang; and Bushi as the King of Jiyin.

translations.literal: Liang divided into five.
translations.idiomatic: Liang was divided into five kingdoms.

translations.literal: Enfeoffed four marquises.
translations.idiomatic: He enfeoffed four marquises.

sentences.zh: 更命廷尉為大理，將作少府為將作大匠，主爵中尉為都尉，長信詹事為長信少府，將行為大長秋，大行為行人，奉常為太常，典客為大行，治粟內史為大農。

translations.literal: Changed name of Superintendent of Trials to Grand Judge, Superintendent of the Imperial Workshops to Grand Artisan of the Imperial Workshops, Superintendent of the Nobility to Commandant of the Capital, Director of the Palace of Enduring Trust to Vice Director of the Palace of Enduring Trust, Chamberlain for the Imperial Harem to Grand Chamberlain for the Imperial Harem, Chamberlain for Ceremonials to Master of Protocol, Grand Master of Ceremonies to Grand Master of Ceremonies, Superintendent of Guests to Grand Herald, Superintendent of the Granaries to Grand Minister of Agriculture.
translations.idiomatic: He changed the title of Superintendent of Trials to Grand Judge, Superintendent of the Imperial Workshops to Grand Artisan of the Imperial Workshops, Superintendent of the Nobility to Commandant of the Capital, Director of the Palace of Enduring Trust to Vice Director of the Palace of Enduring Trust, Chamberlain for the Imperial Harem to Grand Chamberlain for the Imperial Harem, Chamberlain for Ceremonials to Master of Protocol, Grand Master of Ceremonies to Grand Master of Ceremonies, Superintendent of Guests to Grand Herald, and Superintendent of the Granaries to Grand Minister of Agriculture.

sentences.zh: 以大內為二千石，置左右內官，屬大內。

translations.literal: Made the Grand Interior two thousand shi, established left right interior officials, subordinate to the Grand Interior.
translations.idiomatic: He made the Grand Interior a 2000 shi position, established left and right interior officials, subordinate to the Grand Interior.

translations.literal: Seventh month xinhai, solar eclipse.
translations.idiomatic: On the xinhai day of the seventh month, there was a solar eclipse.

translations.literal: Eighth month, Xiongnu entered Shangjun.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month, the Xiongnu invaded Shangjun commandery.

translations.literal: Middle sixth year second month on the day Jimao, traveled to Yong, offered sacrifices seeing the five emperors. Third month, hail fell. Fourth month, Liang Xiaowang, Chengyang Gongwang, Runan Wang all died. Established Liang Xiaowang's son Ming as Jichuan King, son Peng Li as Jidong King, son Ding as Shanyang King, son Bu Shi as Ji Yin King. Liang divided into five. Enfeoffed four marquises. Changed name of Court Judge to Grand Judge, Construction Foreman to Construction Grand Artisan, Chief of Nobility Commandant to Chief Commandant, Longxin Supervisor of Household to Longxin Junior Steward, Director of the Imperial Household to Grand Chamberlain of the Imperial Household, Grand Usher to Usher, Reverent Constant to Grand Constant, Protocol Secretary to Grand Protocol, Grain Intendant to Grand Farmer. Made the Grand Interior two thousand shi, established left and right interior officials, belonging to the Grand Interior. Seventh month on the day Xinhai, eclipse of the sun. Eighth month, Xiongnu entered Shangjun.

sentences.zh: 後元年冬，更命中大夫令為衛尉。

translations.literal: Later first year winter, changed name of Palace Gentlemen Commander to Guard Commander.
translations.idiomatic: In the winter of the first year thereafter, he changed the title of Commander of the Palace Gentlemen to Guard Commander.

sentences.zh: 三月丁酉，赦天下，賜爵一級，中二千石、諸侯相爵右庶長。

translations.literal: Third month dingyou, granted amnesty to all under Heaven, bestowed nobility one level, the middle two thousand shi, the feudal lords chancellors nobility You Shuzhang.
translations.idiomatic: On the dingyou day of the third month, he granted a general amnesty throughout the empire and bestowed one level of nobility on all. Officials of 2000 shi rank and feudal lords' chancellors received the nobility rank of You Shuzhang.

translations.literal: Fourth month, great assembly.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month, there was a great public celebration with drinking.

sentences.zh: 五月丙戌，地動，其蚤食時復動。

translations.literal: Fifth month bingxu, earth moved, its early meal time again moved.
translations.idiomatic: On the bingxu day of the fifth month, there was an earthquake, and it shook again at breakfast time.

sentences.zh: 上庸地動二十二日，壞城垣。

translations.literal: Shangyong earth moved twenty-two days, damaged city walls.
translations.idiomatic: In Shangyong, the earth shook for twenty-two days and damaged the city walls.

translations.literal: Seventh month yisi, solar eclipse.
translations.idiomatic: On the yisi day of the seventh month, there was a solar eclipse.

translations.literal: Chancellor Liu She dismissed.
translations.idiomatic: Chancellor Liu She was dismissed from office.

sentences.zh: 八月壬辰，以御史大夫綰為丞相，封建陵侯。

translations.literal: Eighth month renchen, used the Grandee Secretary Wan as Chancellor, enfeoffed as the Marquis of Jianling.
translations.idiomatic: On the renchen day of the eighth month, he appointed Wan, the Grandee Secretary, as Chancellor and enfeoffed him as the Marquis of Jianling.

translations.literal: Later first year winter, changed name of central palace guard commander to Guard Commander. Third month on the day Dingyou, pardon the world, grant nobility one level, central two thousand shi, feudal lords' chancellors nobility right grandee. Fourth month, great feast. Fifth month on the day Bingxu, earthquake, at the time of early meal again shook. Shangyong earthquake twenty-two days, destroyed city walls. Seventh month on the day Yiji, eclipse of the sun. Chancellor Liu She resigned. Eighth month on the day Renchen, appointed Imperial Secretary Wan as chancellor, enfeoffed as Marquis of Jianling.

sentences.zh: 後二年正月，地一日三動。

translations.literal: Later second year first month, earth one day three times moved.
translations.idiomatic: In the first month of the second year thereafter, the earth shook three times in one day.

translations.literal: Zhi General attacked Xiongnu.
translations.idiomatic: General Zhi attacked the Xiongnu.

translations.literal: Drinking celebration five days.
translations.idiomatic: There was a public drinking celebration for five days.

sentences.zh: 令內史郡不得食馬粟，沒入縣官。

translations.literal: Ordered Interior commanderies should not feed horses grain, confiscated for county officials.
translations.idiomatic: He ordered that the Interior commanderies should not feed grain to horses, and such grain should be confiscated for government use.

translations.literal: Ordered convicts and bondservants wear seven-span cloth.
translations.idiomatic: He ordered that convicts and bondservants should wear clothing made of seven-span cloth.

translations.literal: Stopped horse treading grain.
translations.idiomatic: He stopped the practice of using horses to tread grain.

sentences.zh: 為歲不登，禁天下食不造歲。

translations.literal: Because harvest not good, prohibited all under Heaven eating not made this year.
translations.idiomatic: Because the harvest was poor, he prohibited people throughout the empire from eating grain that was not from the current year's harvest.

translations.literal: Reduced marquises sent them to their states.
translations.idiomatic: He reduced the number of marquises and sent them back to their fiefs.

translations.literal: Third month, Xiongnu entered Yanmen.
translations.idiomatic: In the third month, the Xiongnu invaded Yanmen commandery.

translations.literal: Tenth month, leased Changling fields.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month, he leased out the fields of the Changling tomb.

translations.literal: Great drought.
translations.idiomatic: There was a great drought.

sentences.zh: 衡山國、河東、雲中郡民疫。

translations.literal: Hengshan state, Hedong, Yunzhong commandery people epidemic.
translations.idiomatic: There was an epidemic among the people of Hengshan state and the Hedong and Yunzhong commanderies.

translations.literal: Later second year first month, earth shook three times in one day. General Zhi attacked the Xiongnu. Feast five days. Ordered interior commanderies not to feed horses grain, confiscate to county officials. Ordered convicts to wear seven-span cloth. Stopped horse pounding. Because the year harvest was poor, prohibited the world from eating unfashionable food. Reduced the marquises sent to their fiefs. Third month, Xiongnu entered Yanmen. Tenth month, rented Changling fields. Great drought. Hengshan kingdom, Hedong, Yunzhong commandery people epidemic.

sentences.zh: 後三年十月，日月皆（食）赤五日。

translations.literal: Later third year tenth month, the sun and moon both red five days.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month of the third year thereafter, both the sun and moon appeared red for five days.

translations.literal: Twelfth month last day, thunder.
translations.idiomatic: There was thunder on the last day of the twelfth month.

translations.literal: Sun like purple.
translations.idiomatic: The sun appeared purple.

translations.literal: Five planets retrograde guarded Taiwei.
translations.idiomatic: The five planets moved in retrograde motion and remained close to the Taiwei constellation.

translations.literal: Moon penetrated Heavenly Court center.
translations.idiomatic: The moon passed through the center of the Heavenly Court constellation.

translations.literal: First month jia yin, imperial crown prince capped.
translations.idiomatic: On the jiayin day of the first month, the crown prince came of age.

translations.literal: Jiachen, Emperor Xiaojing collapsed.
translations.idiomatic: On the jiachen day, Emperor Xiaojing passed away.

sentences.zh: 遺詔賜諸侯王以下至民為父後爵一級，天下戶百錢。

translations.literal: Testament granted the feudal lords kings and below to the commoners who succeeded fathers nobility one level, all under Heaven households one hundred cash.
translations.idiomatic: In his testament, he granted one level of nobility to all feudal kings and below, down to commoners who succeeded their fathers, and gave one hundred cash to every household throughout the empire.

sentences.zh: 出宮人歸其家，復無所與。

translations.literal: Released palace people return to their homes, exempted nothing given.
translations.idiomatic: He released the palace women to return to their homes and exempted them from all taxes and labor obligations.

sentences.zh: 太子即位，是為孝武皇帝。

translations.literal: Crown prince ascended throne, this was Emperor Xiaowu.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince ascended the throne; this was Emperor Xiaowu.

sentences.zh: 三月，封皇太后弟蚡為武安侯，弟勝為周陽侯。

translations.literal: Third month, enfeoffed the Empress Dowager younger brother Fen as the Marquis of Wuan, younger brother Sheng as the Marquis of Zhouyang.
translations.idiomatic: In the third month, he enfeoffed the Empress Dowager's younger brother Tian Fen as the Marquis of Wuan and her younger brother Tian Sheng as the Marquis of Zhouyang.

translations.literal: Established Yangling.
translations.idiomatic: He established the Yangling tomb.

translations.literal: Later third year tenth month, sun and moon both appeared red five days. Twelfth month last day, thunder. Sun appeared purple. Five stars moved retrograde guarding Taiwei. Moon passed through the heavenly court center. First month on the day Jiazi, crown prince capped. On the day Jiazi, Emperor Jing died. Testament granted feudal lords and kings below to people who become heirs nobility one level, world households one hundred cash. Sent out palace people to return to their homes, pardoned without giving anything. Crown prince ascended the throne, this was Emperor Wu. Third month, enfeoffed Empress Dowager's younger brother Fen as Marquis of Wuan, younger brother Sheng as Marquis of Zhouyang. Established Yangling.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：漢興，孝文施大德，天下懷安，至孝景，不復憂異姓，而晁錯刻削諸侯，遂使七國俱起，合從而西鄉，以諸侯太盛，而錯為之不以漸也。

translations.literal: Grand Historian said: Han arose, Xiaowen applied great virtue, all under Heaven cherished peace, arrived at Xiaojing, no longer worried about different surnames, but Chao Cuo carved and reduced the feudal lords, consequently caused seven states all to rise, united in alliance and west toward, because feudal lords too powerful, and Cuo did it not gradually.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: When the Han arose, Emperor Xiaowen practiced great virtue, and all under Heaven lived in peace. By Emperor Xiaojing's time, there was no longer concern about rulers of different surnames. But Chao Cuo's harsh reduction of the feudal lords' power caused all seven states to rise up, form an alliance, and march westward. This happened because the feudal lords had grown too powerful, and Cuo acted without proper gradual measures.

sentences.zh: 及主父偃言之，而諸侯以弱，卒以安。

translations.literal: When Zhu Fu Yan spoke about it, then the feudal lords thereby weakened, finally thereby peaceful.
translations.idiomatic: When Zhu Fu Yan spoke out about this situation, the feudal lords were thereby weakened, and finally there was peace.

translations.literal: Safety and danger mechanism, how not through planning?
translations.idiomatic: The pivot between security and peril—is it not through strategic planning?

translations.literal: The Grand Historian says: Han arose, Emperor Wen applied great virtue, the world felt peaceful, to Emperor Jing, no longer worried about different surnames, yet Chao Cuo cut and reduced the feudal lords, thus caused seven kingdoms to rise together, allied and headed west, because the feudal lords were too powerful, and Cuo did it not gradually. When Zhu Fu Yan spoke of it, the feudal lords weakened, finally became peaceful. The mechanism of safety and danger, how can it not be due to planning?
